intro: Thryallis latifolia f. laburnum, commonly known as the golden trumpet plant, is a striking member of the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange tubular flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are typically glossy and dark green, providing a striking contrast to its vibrant flowers. It is native to South America and thrives in warm, humid climates with well-drained soil. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes.
